Fields.DialogueText: Huh, Fusō, what are you doing all alone outside?
Oh, Kanchou!
*THUD*
Ow...
Are you hurt?
I'm fine, I just slipped. You startled me, is all. I didn't hear you come up behind me.
My apologies.
Is anything the matter?

Fields.MenuText: I just wanted to thank you for the help you provided earlier. We couldn't have done it without you.
I'm just checking in on my crew. We're in a war, after all.
I'm proud of the way you fought today.

Fields.DialogueText: It's my duty to serve when needed, Kanchou. I'm glad I was of use!
You're quite kind, Kanchou. It's my honor to be a part of the fight.
Oh, my! Well... thank you.
The next meal will be served downstairs soon. Don't take too much time by yourself.
Understood, Kanchou. I'll just be a moment longer.
@BATTLE
Sorry I'm late. I lost track of time.
I'll excuse you this time, Fusō. Please do your best not to be late for these meetings.
Our scouts report Morganas have been sighted just a few leagues from here.
What? Already?
We've been waiting for confirmation, but... yeah.
We have to go now, before anyone gets hurt!

Fields.MenuText: You sure? We don't know how many are out there. We could be walking into a trap.
Technically, when we're this close to shore, there are protocols we should follow unless there's an attack already underway.
My thoughts exactly, Fusō.

Fields.DialogueText: It's a risk we need to take. If the Funayūrei sank one of my comrades, I'd never forgive myself!
We can't just stand by idly. When I enlisted, I made a promise to serve my country. You did that too, right?
So what are we doing, just waiting here?
I'm glad to hear you say that.
So, shall we make our way up to the deck?
I'm sure they're already waiting for us there.
Gah! I'm always the last to arrive!
It's fine, Fusō. Just don't fall over on your way there.
@BATTLE
*KNOCK*
Who's there?
It's Fusō.
Come in.
Any news from the front?
Nothing yet. Still no reason or motive to the Morgana placement.
I see... well, where to next? I feel eager for the next big battle!

Fields.MenuText: In time, in time. For now, we study this information and get ourselves ready for the next mission.
I'm getting nervous. I feel we're going to be in for a long battle.
We'll be ready, Fusō. I'll make sure of it.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand. Well, I'm here if you need my help.
Kanchou, I trust you and everyone on this ship. I'm sure we can win!
Well, then, I await your orders.
*ALARM*
Set a course. We'll show those Morganas that we're not to be trifled with!
@BATTLE
Fusō, are you here?
Ahh!
Oh, Kanchou... I didn't hear you again.

Fields.MenuText: You seem off today. Is there something you'd like to talk about?
This seems to be an ongoing "thing" we're having. You're not so aware of your surroundings, are you?
I shouldn't have come over here so suddenly.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it's nothing. I feel a little stressed out, is all.
Sometimes I can't hear so well. I blame this clunky outfit I'm wearing.
Oh no, Kanchou, it's fine, I promise.
I'm here if you need me.
I appreciate that.
By the way, does this paper belong to you?
My poetry! Oh!
It's very nice. You should read it out loud sometime.
MORGANA SIGHTED! ALL HANDS ON DECK!
Maybe another time, then?
@BATTLE
Kanchou, have I ever talked to you about my sister?
I don't believe so. Are you two close?
We used to be attached "at the hip," as the English say. We're very similar.
That must be very nice. Remind me of her name...?
Yamashiro.
Yes, that's it. That's a very nice name.
Are... you okay?
I feel a little strange without her. Like a part of me is missing.

Fields.MenuText: There's nothing missing from you, Fusō - and, for the record, I'm so appreciative of the help you've given us on our ship.
Well, maybe you'll be together once we defeat the Morganas.
Is there anything I can do to help? Maybe we can connect you two.

Fields.DialogueText: I am thankful we have a kanchou who gives such individualized attention!
Maybe. It just feels funny to be away from her. We spent so much of our lives side by side.
I don't think so.
Fusō...
Promise me, Kanchou, that you'll stay this kind and helpful for the whole war. I want to get better, and stronger, and away from this cumbersome armor.
You have my word.
@BATTLE
Fusō, I'm glad you came to see me today.
Is something the matter?
Not at all. In fact, quite the opposite. Here, read this.
Hmm... headquarters... upgrade... Kanchou, is this legitimate?
Don't get too excited. Refits on Belle-active ships have very specific protocols, and big changes get spaced out so you guys have a chance to adapt.
Oh, thank you!

Fields.MenuText: Consider it the first part of my promise.
You said you wanted to get stronger, so I put the order in right away.
The only person you need to thank is yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew I could rely on you!
Well, I hope it won't take so long to get all the way to the HQ.
No, Kanchou. This can't just be on me. We're a team, right?
Hear, hear.
@BATTLE
I know, I know. But...

The changes we're talking about here are... honestly, they're cosmetic. But if they take and you don't have a problem with them, then Command might be willing to talk about a more accelerated program.
What are we doing all the way out here?
I was told it was like a treasure hunt for Morganas.
Oh! We're on the attack, aren't we?
We're on the offensive.
I'm never on the attack, at least, not usually. I'm more used to... bringing up the rear.
You see that? Morganas are sighted. It's time for an attack!
@BATTLE
So how did it feel? To not be behind everyone else for once?
You know, I think I liked it!
Kanchou!
*THUD*
I should have told you not to run in the mess hall. The floors were just cleaned.
That would have been helpful information to have ahead of time.
Hmm...
What's on your mind?

Fields.MenuText: We've been fighting Morganas for some time, with no sign of them slowing down.
Do you think HQ received our message yet? It's been a little while now.
I'm just trying to figure out why you're so clumsy here, but an ace on the battlefield.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, the Funayūrei are fierce! I wouldn't expect them to just roll over and give up.
I'd give it some time. We only sent it out the other day, you know.
It has to do with focus, I think. Focus on the field helps clear the mind.
I understand you more and more each day, you know that?
I assume it's just another effect of the war.
@BATTLE
Fusō, are you writing more poetry?
Yes. A haiku, about my home.
Can you read me some?
Every leaf falls
Telling their story tonight
While forests crumble
What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: I loved it!
It could use some work.
I didn't like it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you enjoyed it! It came from the heart!
I think so too. I'm not that great of a poet, I feel.
Oh, I'm... sorry to hear that, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Well, it may be time to put the book down for now. Let's give those Morganas a story to tell!
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Come quick!
Fusō, look out!
*THUD*
Ow, I think I hurt myself this time...
What are you doing, running around the ship like this?
Notice anything... different?

Fields.MenuText: The new upgrades! You put them on?
I don't see anything different.
Did you cut your hair?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes? They're so shiny. How do I look?
The new upgrades! Don't they look nice?
Kanchou! Really?
You look great, Fusō. Really.
You did notice, right?
You look great. How does it feel?
I'm a little stiff, but ready to go.
Well, we'll have a chance to have a go sooner than we think!
@BATTLE
How are the upgrades, Fusō? Should I report back to HQ?
Well there's still some parts to get used to.
I'll let HQ know.
Thanks. Now that I have some new customization, we'll be able to knock the rest of those Morganas out of the water!

Fields.MenuText: By the way, when was your last upgrade?
Hmm, you look a little eager for battle.
Now, that's the attitude a captain wants to hear!

Fields.DialogueText: It's been a little while.
Well if you looked this good, wouldn't you feel the same way?
So where's the Morgana? I'm ready.
Well, I guess I'm just happy that you feel good about yourself.
Thank you, Kanchou. But if I could be honest? I'd just like nothing more than to take this off and have a hot bath!
Maybe if we defeat enough Morganas, we can earn us all a little R&R.
@BATTLE
Well, Kanchou, we've been traveling quite a bit, but I can't quite feel comfortable in what I've been outfitted with.
I haven't noticed any adverse effects in combat, for what it's worth.
Well, thank goodness for that. But... I feel every time I change, nothing...
Fits?
Exactly.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I can write a letter to the higher-ups to get something that feels more comfortable.
Then just wait a little longer. It'll be fine.
Maybe there's just a little more maintenance we can do?

Fields.DialogueText: If you can do that, I'd appreciate it!
I'll try. Usually, it helps to have a little more time on my feet.
I hope that helps. I'll try and rally the crew.
Thanks for coming to me with this. I know it's awkward, but it's important.
Hai. Thank you, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Okay, first, I feel like I should say that I'm told Belle refits are spaced out for a reason. You're not the first one who's reported some distress accompanying changes.
In theory, going back to your old arrangement for a few days, or weeks, or whatever would just make the problem go away.
I don't want to give up on this yet. If I need to get used to this to have even better equipment, then I want to keep at it.
Okay.
Fusō, have you read this report?
No, I haven't. What is it?
It's a report of more Morgana sightings. Seems this war won't be ending any time soon.
But we're doing an amazing job, aren't we?

Fields.MenuText: I would say so.
We're doing the best we can.
Sometimes we're on target, but other times we can do better.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I think our kanchou should be congratulated. Perhaps with some... festivities?
And we're only getting stronger.
Well, I do plan on doing my part, Kanchou.
Whatever the plan, I can tell you it's not over.
What comes next then, Kanchou?
*ALARM*
Whatever is causing that noise, I assume!
@BATTLE
How are you holding up?
With the new equipment, you mean? It won't be a problem, Kanchou!
... Well, tell me if it is.
Hai!
Fusō?
Ahh!
I mean, oh, Kanchou, how are you?
Seems not much has changed for you, eh?
If by that, you mean I've been serving my nation and this ship, then yes, I'm very much the same.
I meant more that you're unaware of when I approach you.
I would hope you find qualities like that redeeming in a person like me.

Fields.MenuText: Of course, Fusō.
Well, it'd be appreciated if you showed some more dedication outside of the battlefield.
Now, what kind of qualities would those be?

Fields.DialogueText: It's very nice to be serving with a kanchou who understands.
Hey! I do my part around here, like everyone else.
Kanchou, we know each other fairly well, so I think you know the answer to that.
By the way, have you still been writing poetry?
A little bit. But it's not ready to be read out loud yet. Maybe later.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, did the mail come in yet?
Yes. In fact, I'm going through the stack right now. Nothing from HQ, but I do see this letter here addressed to you.
Thank you. It's probably from my sister.
Do you write her often?
Not really. But since the war, I've been feeling lonely.
When we were younger, Yamashiro and I used to play these games. We would pick an object, and take turns guessing. For each incorrect guess, another clue would be revealed.
Hm. It sounds like a fun game between sisters.
What's dark, strong, and ready to destroy our ship?

Fields.MenuText: A torpedo?
A bullet?
I don't think I like the way this is going.

Fields.DialogueText: That's true, but not what I'm looking for.
That's true, but not what I'm looking for.
Come on, can't you just play along?
Okay, so tell me.
The Funayūrei, and they're attacking now!
@BATTLE
This was... even before you were awakened?
It's like a dream now - but, yes.
Fusō, I'm glad I ran into you. We received a response from HQ, and...
And what?
We got a little more than a response. They've sent what they're calling "dummy gear" for you to try.
Let me see... hmm... well, it's certainly not ideal.
I know - and if it's a problem we'll deal with it. But for now, we've got some trouble up ahead.
@BATTLE
How are the new arrivals?

Fields.MenuText: Still shiny, I see.
You did great out there!
I'm sure it's just an adjustment.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, though I don't feel as pleased with this as I used to be.
Thanks! I appreciate the opportunity, Kanchou.
I agree, but this just doesn't seem like an adjustment I want to have.
Well, we can always cut this experiment off if it's unpleasant for you - or endangering the crew.
Thank you, Kanchou.
Dummy... gear?
Don't take it personally. They want to test the limits of what you can incorporate in a short period of time.
*ALARM*
Well, that's... a lot of Funayūrei.
Think how proud you'll feel when we've beaten them.
@BATTLE
Gah! I'm so exhausted.
You know, you could be alone right now, taking a nap.
And miss out? You know how I don't like to be left behind.
You won't be missing out on anything. We're just prepping to eat right now.
I just know that as soon as I leave, Funayūrei are going to be at the gates, and I'll have to get myself ready for battle all over again.

Fields.MenuText: You say that like it's the worst thing ever.
I promise we wouldn't fight without you.
Maybe you could use a break?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you try lugging all of this extra rubble around all day and then talk to me.
Will you walk to my room? And wake me up?
I think we can all use a little break, Kanchou.
So I suppose we can just let this go, eh?
I think it's best we discuss the upgrades a little later.
Fusō, did you receive new dummy  gear? Again?
Hai. It seems HQ considers this a very promising experiment.
There's something wrong, isn't there? You look a little off.
Now that you're mentioning it, I don't feel so comfortable.

Fields.MenuText: If this is worth doing, it's worth doing. You're being a very good sport, though.
We can see if we can make you feel more comfortable after a battle or two with those Morganas.
Could we send another letter to HQ?

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kanchou.
Well, if I don't feel comfortable now, I doubt I'll be comfortable later.
Sending another letter won't help. I can do my best as is.
There's one more option. You could just go back to what you used to have.
No! If I took all the new stuff off, then there'd be no hope of really useful new gear. I'd just be the same old Fusō.
@BATTLE
Good day, Kanchou.
Good day. Did you want to see me for any reason?
I've been thinking about what you said the other day. I'm not sure if this gear feels like "me."
Your combat performance has always been the same, for what it's worth.
Well, I feel that I need to try extra hard to be more like myself.
Can I let you in on a secret, Fusō?

Fields.MenuText: I feel the same way very often when it comes to new clothes or gear, and I hate it too.
To be honest, I didn't mind the old Fusō. She looked good to me.
I had the same problem as you. We all grow out of that feeling, trust me.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad we're on the same page. I'd feel more awkward if I knew it was just me who felt this way.
Really? I guess that makes me feel a little better. I'm still not sure what I want to do just yet.
If you say so, Kanchou.
Just trust me, Fusō. I think everything will work out in the end.
Okay, I understand. Kanchou?
Yes?
Thank you for being kind about this.
@BATTLE
Out of my way, Kanchou. I'm heading to my quarters.
Are you going to sleep for a while?
Not yet. There's a bottle of sake with my name on it.
In a foul mood, eh?
I'm done with this. These retrofit upgrades. New gear, new armor. I feel like I can't even walk anymore!

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry, Fusō. Is there anything I can do to help?
What do you want me to do about it?
That armor is not working. Get it off. Captain's orders.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't bother, Kanchou. I'm going to deal with this myself.
Nothing. I'll just figure something out.
Just as soon as I get that drink.
It's either upgrade or be the last one to the party...
Fusō, there has to be another way.
No. I'm tired of feeling like I need to be somewhere...
@BATTLE
Are you feeling any better, Fusō?
I've made my decision, Kanchou. I'm tired of trying to scramble myself together. I should love me for being me, right?
You're right.
That means I don't have to catch up, I'll go at my own pace, and we'll win the war our way.

Fields.MenuText: I think that's a great idea.
I don't think that's such a good idea.
You do whatever you want. I'll support you either way.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm excited to finally feel like myself again. Ay! I could use another relaxing bath!
What's not such a good idea? To be me again?
Thank you, Kanchou. I'm confident this will be the last time you'll hear this complaint!
Now if you'll excuse me...
*ALARM*
That sounds like trouble. We'll have to continue our conversation at another time!
@BATTLE
... And that's the last of it!
The last of what?
Eek! You have to stop scaring me like that.
Did you figure yourself out? All the dummy gear is crated up?
Hai. From now on, I go at my own pace and do my best. I'll do my duty no matter what my duty is!

Fields.MenuText: I'm proud of you, Fusō.
Good job. A soldier should always know what's best for their body and mind.
Well, I'm just glad you found your niche.

Fields.DialogueText: Proud? Really? Don't make me blush!
I'm ready for the next command, Kanchou!
I may not be there for an all-out assault, but when it comes to helping my country, you know I'll be there.
When this is all over, we'll celebrate. Does that sound good?
Yes, yes it does.
@BATTLE
Excuse me, Kanchou, do you have a moment?
Of course. Is something the matter?
I'd like to read this poem to you.
Go right ahead.
I tried something a little different from the past.
Willows grow wider
Roots that clutch, branches that lean
Stumbling forward
So, what do you think?

Fields.MenuText: I loved it.
It was okay.
It wasn't great.

Fields.DialogueText: I love it too.
I guess it needs some work, huh.
Shoot. Well, at least I tried something different.
At the very least, I can tell it was something personal. And that means enough for me.
Thanks, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Now, if we position ourselves twenty leagues west, we'll have an unparalleled advantage...
Well, the meeting is almost over, and she still hasn't arrived...
Wait, wait, don't start without me!
Oh.
Fusō, we started nearly an hour ago. Where were you?
Would you believe me if I told you I was harvesting oysters?

Fields.MenuText: Ah, Fusō, what are we going to do with you?
Other ships would have you doing hard time, pulling stuff like this.
It's no worry at all. In fact, I expected it.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, I'm very, very sorry. I'll make it up to you!
Please don't put me on mess hall duty...
Well, maybe I'll come late a little more often, eh?
I guess it can't be helped... Fusō, talk to the steward. I had him take notes for you.
Yes, Kanchou!
Same old Fusō...
@BATTLE
Are you enjoying tonight's festivities?
Yes, Kanchou!
*GULP*
Fusō... how many of those oysters have you eaten?
Hmm, I seemed to have lost count.
There's a lot here. And sake?
Do you want one?
Well, maybe just one...
*GULP*
Bleh! This tastes like rotten shellfish. How did you eat these?
Oh come on, they're not that bad. You probably just got a gross one.
Anyhow, I wanted to tell you that I think you've been doing well. Your good attitude has been infectious - the crew is as content as I've ever seen them.
I've been finding it a lot easier these days. I may not be the fastest, or always on time, but I'm happy.

Fields.MenuText: I think your sister would be happy to know that you're happy, too.
You may not be on time, but I don't know who else on this ship writes beautiful poetry like you.
